Article.ArticleTitle: Nanostructured (Co, Mn)<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> for High Capacitive Supercapacitor Applications.

AbstractText: Nanostructured Co doped Mn<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> spinel structure ((Co, Mn)<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub>) were prepared by co-precipitation under O<sub>3</sub> oxidizing conditions and post-heat treatment. The product was composed of nanogranules with a diameter of 20-60 nm. The electrochemical performance of (Co, Mn)<sub>3</sub>O<sub>4</sub> electrode was tested by cyclic voltammetry, impedance, and galvanostatic charge-discharge measurements. A maximum specific capacitance value of 2701.0 F g<sup>-1</sup> at a current density of 5 A g<sup>-1</sup> could be obtained within the potential range from 0.01 to 0.55 V versus Hg/HgO electrode in 6 mol L<sup>-1</sup> KOH electrolyte. When at high current density of 30 A g<sup>-1</sup>, the capacitance is 1537.2 F g<sup>-1</sup> or 56.9% of the specific capacitance at 5 A g<sup>-1</sup>, indicating its good rate capability. After 500 cycles at 20 A g<sup>-1</sup>, the specific capacitance remains 1324 F g<sup>-1</sup> with a capacitance retention of 76.4%.
